title: Matt Smith webchat â your questions on fear, football and a female Doctor Who | Stage | The Guardian
summary: matt smith 's mantra : wear bright socks and do n't let the bastards grind you down .
`` i think a lady doctor could be close ''
`` one fan told me i looked like a hedgehog . which i thought was beguiling . ''
`` it 's a lifelong quest to be good at relaxing ''
`` i miss time travelling . but it 's peter 's tardis now ''
`` we 've started communicating with our thumbs ''

documents.title: that 's all from matt
text: guardian contributor mattsmith1 19 july 2016 1:55pm thanks for your questions guys .
leave your desks .
run out into the sun !
defy your bosses .
and remember .
england is never this sunny .
ever .
so enjoy it , cats .
go and listen to some oasis in a park and think of me .
matt .
and , as promised , here 's that face illustration he mentioned earlier on : matt smith 's drawing of a face

documents.title: matt smith 's mantra : wear bright socks and do n't let the bastards grind you down
text: kristina wilde asks : do you have a mantra or philosophy , at work or otherwise , and what is it ?
guardian contributor mattsmith1 19 july 2016 1:54pm wear bright socks .
true .
although i am sockless today .
be bold , man , be bold this day .
do n't give up ever .
and do n't let the bastards grind you down .
jackiefromtoronto asks : how important is your collaboration with the playwright ?
from my understanding , anthony neilson has let the actors have a lot of input into unreachable .
how has this experience differed from your previous roles/interactions with playwrights ?
guardian contributor mattsmith1 19 july 2016 1:53pm really important .
it 's the nexus of the play .
and i was always a fan of anthony 's work .
so was intrigued to experience his process and i hope together with the rest of the cast and anthony we 've created something unique and unlike anything else .
jackiefromtoronto asks : after the craziness of last football season and all the changes leading into the new season ( josã© at united , etc ) , who is your to win the league ?
mattsmith1 19 july 2016 1:52pm good question .
it 's so tough .
at this stage who knows ?
because leicester won it last year .
so it truly means anyone can have a go .
but united will be stronger for sure .
so will chelsea .
so will city .
i 'd probably go for one of those three .
but i hope it 's someone other than then .
i think it 's good for football and the premier league when it 's outside the top four .
go leicester !
masha onceuponinrussia asks : how are you ?
mattsmith1 19 july 2016 1:50pm i am very well thank you .
how are you ?
i am going to sit in the sun .
then i am going to go and do my play unreachable .
and then i am going to watch the final episode of narcos .
so thank you for asking .
cmacgregor93 asks : do you still have charlie the badger ?
how 's he doing these days ?
mattsmith1 19 july 2016 1:49pm i do !
he 's in my flat .
and he 's hanging out .

documents.title: `` i think a lady doctor could be close ''
text: mamaca asks : how does my daughter become the doctor ?
she wants to know .
thanks !
mattsmith1 19 july 2016 1:48pm well , she has a chance .
i think a lady doctor could be close .
and would be fun .
so practise , practise , practise .
and talk really fast .
and think really fast .
and be really brave .
and mad .
and silly .
and good luck maybe it will be you !
breann asks : how do you muffle the inner voices of doubt and fear whenever you perform ?
mattsmith1 19 july 2016 1:47pm i do n't !
they seep out of my ears .
and you have to just take a leap of faith , a risk of madness there 's failure and you have got to say , screw you failure , i 'm here for the truth not for success !
hugo lefebvre asks : when can we expect the movie on robert mappletorphe to be released ?
do you think it 's going to be a huge success ?
mattsmith1 19 july 2016 1:46pm i do n't know and i do n't know .
sorry to be vague .
but i really do n't know .
cerysbaines82 asks : which play that you have either seen/read/taken part in has influenced you the most and why ?
mattsmith1 19 july 2016 1:45pm great question cerys .
i love noises off when i was young .
that face was really important for me .
american pyscho was pretty groovy .
unreachable cos it 's mental and i 'm in it at the moment .
and simon stephens .
on the shore of the wide world just because the rhythm and tone of his writing is so attractive .
and he took a risk on me .
the royal court generally because that 's where i started .
i think it 's really important to support new writing and new writers .
skye asks : did it hurt when you regenerated ?
mattsmith1 19 july 2016 1:43pm yes .
in all of my bones .
and my two hearts .
samkrasp asks : do you like fish fingers and custard in real life ?
mattsmith1 19 july 2016 1:42pm yes of course .
who would n't !
are you insane ?
lawrence van rijn asks : what was the biggest challenge for you in unreachable and why ?
mattsmith1 19 july 2016 1:41pm having no script .
not knowing what was happening .
but by the same token those challenges are what define the tone and nature of the piece .
so it 's a catch 22 .
but somehow a good one i hope .
ezra23 asks : which tv shows did you enjoy watching this year ?
mattsmith1 19 july 2016 1:41pm narcos .
the detectorists with toby jones and mackenzie crooke .
it 's brilliant .
watch it .
myo asks : who would win in a celebrity death match : cumberbatch 's sherlock or tennant 's dr who ?
and why ?
mattsmith1 19 july 2016 1:40pm god it would be a bloodbath !
i dunno is the honest answer but i want a frontrow seat and i 'll fight the winner .
ruthnotroof asks : do you regret how being doctor who may have defined your career and your succeeding roles ?
mattsmith1 19 july 2016 1:38pm no , absolutely not .
i 'm very grateful for everything doctor who has done for me .
it 's opened more doors than it 's closed .
like everything it 's a process of time .
in ten years , hopefully , i 'll be known for something else .

documents.title: `` one fan told me i looked like a hedgehog . which i thought was beguiling . ''
text: elvira gimadieva asks : you are a famous person .
how does it feel ?
how do you feel when you are surrounded by fans ?
mattsmith1 19 july 2016 1:37pm good .
i feel good when i 'm surrounded by doctor who fans cos they are nice people and they are supportive .
generally .
although one of them told me i looked like a hedgehog .
which i thought was beguiling .
but made me think .

documents.title: `` it 's a lifelong quest to be good at relaxing ''
text: goldendays49 asks what do you do when you are unemployed ?
mattsmith1 19 july 2016 1:36pm not enough .
it 's a lifelong quest to be good at relaxing .
and productive when you 're not meant to be productive .
any tips ?
elvira gimadieva asks : do you have secret talents ?
mattsmith1 19 july 2016 1:35pm sadly not .
at least none that i know about .
maybe they will reveal themselves to me and i will secretly turn out to be the best trapeze artist in north london .
or secretly i 'll turn out to be able to eat the most sausages in a day .
or secretly i 'll be the new keith jarrett .
swearword ( real name otis , age 5 ) asks : i love doctor who and you 're one of my favourite doctors .
i 'm not kidding .
who 's your second worst enemy that 's not the daleks ?
mattsmith1 19 july 2016 1:34pm good question otis !
my scariest enemy is the weeping angel but secret , they are also my favourite .
smartcutebabybird asks : how often do you read ?
do you have a favourite book ?
mattsmith1 19 july 2016 1:31pm not enough .
and yes , i do have a favourite book .
in fact i have two .
the master and the margarita .
it 's a fucking great book .
and the bfg .
i 'm definitely going to see the film .
for sure .
spielberg and rylance .
winner !
smartcutebabybird asks : which of your childhood dreams have come true ?
mattsmith1 19 july 2016 1:30pm boris becoming foreign secretary not !
mary jane bertel asks : would you ever consider accepting another long-term role on television ?
mattsmith1 19 july 2016 1:29pm yes .
i am doing one at the moment .
i am playing prince philip on netflix for the crown .
we shoot for six months of the year

documents.title: `` i miss time travelling . but it 's peter 's tardis now ''
text: kseny & jenny ask : 1 .
do you miss doctor who ? 2 .
there were rumours that you would return for the 10th season .
is this true ?
mattsmith1 19 july 2016 1:28pm yes i miss it .
no it 's not true i miss everything .
i miss steven , i miss karen , i miss arthur , i miss jenna .
i miss time travelling .
and i miss my friends in cardiff .
but onward goes the march .
it 's peter 's tardis now .
and i love what he does .
so i watch as a fan .
matt smith /pa rory00 asks : if you had a real tardis and you could go back in time , what would you say to your younger self ?
mattsmith1 19 july 2016 1:25pm i 'd take the tardis back to watch blackburn win the league .
i 'd go and see oasis play in chicago in 1994 .
i 'd go and up frank sinatra .
and marilyn monroe .
take em to see some dinosaurs .
hire a boat in the 30s , get frank to sing .
drop him back off in the 50s .
and take marilyn to a nice hotel !
with the dinosaurs outside .

mattsmith1 19 july 2016 1:27pm as to what i 'd say to my old self , i 'd say put a bet on blackburn winning the league and start watching doctor who cos you might be in it one day and you 've never watched it
musetta asks : on a scale of 1-10 , how frightened are you of jonjo o'neill ?
mattsmith1 19 july 2016 1:24pm ten .
he just broke my finger .
on purpose .
seriously .
he planted a leaf on stage .
and his hair is frightening .
matt smith ( maxim ) and jonjo o'neill ( the brute ) in unreachable kenton for the guardian
james le lacheur asks : what was the rehearsal process like for unreachable ?
how much of yours and the rest of the cast 's improvisation made it into the script , and is it still evolving now ?
is the show ever really frozen ?
saw it last night and it was one of the most deliriously entertaining things i 've seen in years .
mattsmith1 19 july 2016 1:23pm the script is still evolving , the rehearsal process was odd , strange , different .
bizarre .
all of the things you see on stage really .
and it 's unlike anything you undertake .
thanks for coming to see the show .
pleased you like it .
it 's got a weird edge i think .
anthony says it works as a metaphor - that 's what it 's there for .
anastacia good asks : how would you describe yourself in three words ?
mattsmith1 19 july 2016 1:21pm christ !
no , not that one .
messy .
no that one .
friendly .
no not that one .
um , um , um .
i do n't know .
exhales .
i 'm going to leave it to you .
sabinelau asks : i 've heard you draw/paint .
is it possible to see some of your work somewhere ?
mattsmith1 19 july 2016 1:19pm i draw the same face over and over again .
i 'll send you a i do n't know what it says about me .
maybe i started doing it when i was in that face .
julian wadham ( hugh ) , matt smith ( henry ) and lindsay duncan ( martha ) in that face kenton for the guardian
debby kulikovsky asks : hi matt , i know you are a music lover .
who would be on your ultimate music festival line-up ?
mattsmith1 19 july 2016 1:18pm wow cool good .
first we 'll go with arcade fire .
followed with radiohead playing kid a and in rainbow followed by oasis headlining .
day two : we are going to start with the chemical brothers .
come on smithers thing .
nars .
and then , we 'll need someone fun and jazzy .
i 've got bowie staring down at me but no .
they need to be alive .
ah , i tell you what .
daft punk .
i 've never seen daft punk live .
roslyn adlam asks : who was your childhood hero ?
are they still your hero now ?
mattsmith1 19 july 2016 1:17pm i used to love stuart pearce .
do you know what ?
this sounds a bit sentimental .
my dad was my hero .
and probably still is .
my old man david !
he 's an absolute rude dog .
parnianb asks : which is harder , playing a legendary fictional character or performing live theatre nightly ?
mattsmith1 19 july 2016 1:12pm they are both equally hard as each other .
the thing is with being an actor , once you 've got over one mountain you have to look at another in a different way .
and climbing mountains always makes you nervous .
smartcutebabybird asks : what is your superpower ?
mattsmith1 19 july 2016 1:11pm i can fly .
anastacia good asks : do you have any idols ?
mattsmith1 19 july 2016 1:11pm noel gallagher .
i love noel .
i tell you who i am really intrigued by at the moment just because of the balls on the man is zlatan ibrahimovic he just seems utterly impressive .
and just anyone that can dominate sport really because the mental strength and singularity you need to be a top sports person is amazing and something that every artist can learn from .

documents.title: `` we 've started communicating with our thumbs ''
text: elvira gimadieva asks : why you do n't have any social media pages ?
you should get one .
mattsmith1 19 july 2016 1:09pm because i like talking to people .
and i look at my phone too much anyway .
and they advent of social media just make me feel a bit weird .
we 've started communicating with our thumbs .
and i think people consider social media for far too much of their day .
look what we 're doing now !
this is n't normal .
it 's sunny .
we should all be outside .
anastacia good asks : imagine the situation : for one minute , the whole world is listening to you .
what would you say ?
mattsmith1 19 july 2016 1:06pm listen to what 's the story morning glory .
loud .
listen to slide away .
loud .
listen to every radiohead album .
read a simon stephens play .
and remember : blackburn rovers won the league in 1996 .
abbiecopson asks : would you ever like to direct again ?
i loved cargese and thought that you made a great director .
mattsmith1 19 july 2016 1:04pm thank you very much abbie .
yes i would .
i think about it a lot .
trying to find the right thing .
although i saw simon stephens who wrote cargese , he came to see the play i 'm in , unreachable , and i realised that i love him !
i want to direct again .
watch this space .

documents.title: matt smith is with us now
text: mattsmith1 19 july 2016 1:02pm word up !
what 's cooking .
it 's a hot day how have you got time to type questions - should n't you be at work ?
let 's begin !
matt smith

documents.title: post your questions for matt smith
text: with a single flourish of a sonic screwdriver , matt smith saw his star wattage explode after he was cast as doctor who in 2010 .
for four years he battled forces across the four dimensions , leaving doomed romance , bow ties and a bafta nomination in his wake .

since passing the baton to peter capaldi , smith has appeared in some eye-catching film roles , such as the lead in ryan gosling 's feature debut lost river , and an ai baddie in terminator : genysis .
he 's performed in a number of plays wielding the axe in 2013 's american psycho and now playing an obsessional film director in unreachable , at the royal court .
matt is joining us to answer your questions about unreachable and anything else in his career .
a live webchat with him will start at 1pm bst on tuesday 19 july ( rescheduled from 12 july ) post your questions for him in the comments below .

bulletin.text: The actor took part in a live webchat - addressing his love of Noel Gallagher, his disdain for social media and why wearing bright socks is his rule for life.
